definition: Fu Hao (c. 1200 BC), or Lady Hao, female Chinese general of the late Shang Dynasty 商朝[Shang1 chao2]
old variant of 婦|妇[fu4]
woman
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: This is the tomb of Fu Hao.
So far, I do not see what is inside the tomb of Fu Hao Hongshan jade.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止，我没有看出妇好墓里哪些是红山的玉器。

sentences.english: It seems to bear the name of Fu Hao on it.
sentences.chinese: 上面好像还有妇好的名字。

definition: Wu Ding (c. 14th century BC), legendary founder and wise ruler of Shang dynasty
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
oracle inscriptions of the Shang Dynasty (16th-11th century BC) on tortoiseshells or animal bones
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
Emperor Xin, last ruler of Shang (11th Century BC), famous as a tyrant
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
Di Yi (died 1076 BC), Shang dynasty king, reigned 1101-1076 BC
Yinxu, ruins of Yinshang 殷商 city at Anyang 安陽|安阳 in Henan province, a World Heritage site
Zhou Dynasty term for a northern nomadic tribe later called the Xiongnu 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2] in the Qin and Han Dynasties
burial goods/burial gifts
King Xuan, eleventh King of Zhou, reigned (828-782 BC)
King Zhuang of Chu (reigned 613-591 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
occupant of tomb/person buried
ritual object/sacrificial vessel
